item.title: Field Experiment announces 2016 finalists | Atlanta News & Opinion Blog | Fresh Loaf | Creative Loafing Atlanta
item.description:
Field Experiment announces 2016 finalists | Atlanta News & Opinion Blog | Fresh Loaf | Creative Loafing Atlanta

click to enlarge COURTESY FIELD EXPERIMENT Out of 77 applications from over five countries, the Goat Farm Arts Center and the Hambidge Center selected five finalists for this year'sField Experiment . If you don't remember, Field Experiment is a public action project where artists receive money to bring dream projects to life with one winner taking it to the next level.

item.title: Lauren Peterson
item.description:
Lauren Peterson

Lauren Peterson collects "devalued" objects (what we mostly think of as trash) and re-contextualizes them to talk about their switch from functional to material. Lauren works in a studio at Atlanta's Goat Farm Arts Center as part of MINT Gallery's Leap Year program for 2015/16. Also available on YouTube.

item.title: Meet a blacksmith: Mark Hopper
item.description:
Meet a blacksmith: Mark Hopper

Mark Hopper: I grew up making things. My grandfather was a cabinet maker, so every summer we'd hang out in his woodshed: painting, playing with charcoals and pastels. I eventually got into woodwork and wanted to make the metal components that went into it.
